result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Bernard Conner Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan Bernard Conner Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan Bernard Conner Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Nathan Bernard Conner Jr was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for UP TO 24 MONTHS (if defendant completes the following conditions prior to the 24 MONTHS probation, it is up to the Agent to request probation be terminated early) with the following conditions:

Restitution set at ZERO.
Court found defendant indigent and waived ALL MANDATORY & NON-MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a mental health assessment and any recommended treatment.
Successfully complete the Thinking For Change course or a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Course.
No Contact with the Taco Bell located at 2210 W Wisconsin Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53233, SH (from case 19CM2519), VP or DJ.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Bernard Conner Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner Jr in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Nathan Bernard Conner Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for Jury Trial, parties have reached a resolution. Discussion as to victim notification as to sentencing, for reasons placed on the record court will proceed to sentencing.
State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:   
Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 2, credit of 10 days time served. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1.
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for UP TO 24 MONTHS (if defendant completes the following conditions prior to the 24 MONTHS probation, it is up to the Agent to request probation be terminated early) with the following conditions:

- Complete a mental health assessment and any recommended treatment
- Successfully complete the Thinking For Change course or a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Course
- No Contact with the Taco Bell located at 2210 W Wisconsin Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53233, SH (from case 19CM2519), VP or DJ.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
- Maintain employment as able
- Court found defendant indigent and waived ALL MANDATORY & NON-MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests the status conference on 9/19/2022 to be converted to a Jury Trial as this case will not be joined with defendant's pending matter 19CM2519 which is set for Jury Trial.
Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 13.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathan Bernard Conner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for a Status Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter  (19CM2519) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for status conference. 
Defendant advised his attorney is in trial in another branch and a new date will be set. Defendant advised as to new date.
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Danny A Jeter
Virgil Postlewaite
Angelica Murray
Taco Bell at 2210 W Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee, WI
730 N 23rd Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Nathan Bernard Conner in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathan Bernard Conner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
